qas.question: How many tiers  does somerset county consist of

answers.text: The ceremonial county of Somerset consists of a two-tier non-metropolitan county

qas.question: What are the 5 districts of Somerset

answers.text: The five districts of Somerset are West Somerset, South Somerset, Taunton Deane, Mendip, and Sedgemoor

qas.question: What 2 Unitary authorities were established in april 1996

answers.text: North Somerset, and Bath & North East Somerset

qas.question: For how many years did Avon county exist?
What was the main city of Avon County?
How many districts made up Avon County?
What type of county was Avon?
How many tiers did Avon County have for its form of government?

context: <a0_0>The <b6_0>ceremonial<b6_0/> county of Somerset consists of a <b7_0>two<b7_0/>-tier non-metropolitan county<a0_0/>, which is administered by Somerset County Council and five district councils, and two unitary authority areas (whose councils combine the functions of a county and a district). <a1_0>The <b3_0><b5_0>five<b5_0/><b3_0/> districts of Somerset are West Somerset, South Somerset, Taunton Deane, Mendip, and Sedgemoor<a1_0/>. The two unitary authorities — which were established on 1 April 1996 following the break-up of the short-lived county of Avon — are <a2_0><b4_0>North Somerset<b4_0/>, and Bath & North East Somerset<a2_0/>.
